DOC.brief_summary: We aimed to investigate the efficiency of chemical oocyte activation using readymade Ca2+ ionophore on cases with previously cancelled cases due to fertilization arrest at pronuclear stage i.e: cleavage failure to find out if there is any improvement in embryonic developmental stages.
DOC.brief_title: Effect of Ca2+ Ionophore on Embryonic Development and Clinical Outcome in Cases With Previous Fertilization Arrest
DOC.detailed_description: Many studies reported that Ca2+ ionophore has a positive effect on embryo development in cases with complete or partial fertilization failure. However, only one preliminary report suggested a beneficial effect of Ca2+ ionophore activation in four cases with fertilization arrest.
DOC.criteria: Patients with previous history of complete fertilization arrest. ovarian stimulation with the GnRH agonist and recombinant FSH in a long protocol. Female age >40 years
